TopicTitle: [1.9.x] Action Groups ReExtended: 250 Action Groups, in-flight editing.

Articles.Content: I will admit I just copied over things instead of doing my usual delete before install because I thought I was just adding some missing files but yea, still showing localization strings here too. Had it also when armageddon made the report but hadn't tried a re-install before making my own report

I'm not sure if it's worth noting or not, but I don't seem to have the problem in the flight scene. It's only been in the VAB for me. It all still works, I can edit/create action groups and all that, it's just the strings being shown...and even that, is only in the VAB. If that helps at all.

One of my favorite mods either way though. You do good work!

Edited January 30, 2018 by tm24fan8
Clarified vague-ish wording
yea I'm not dying for a fix over here either, LGG will get back around to it in due time

New release, 2.3.2.2:

  • Fixed localization strings in the editor

Thanks for keeping this mod updated, it's my fav of the action group tools. I just wanted to see if I understand, the issue with seeing text strings instead of titles is the localization fix right?

I was having that issue too, but now I see there's another update.

For all those who are looking for a video explaining all the features, there is an excellent one posted by Kottabos Games (today!) on YouTube here: 

@linuxgurugamer, maybe you could add this to the OP? I think many would find it useful.

4 hours ago, eightiesboi said:

@linuxgurugamer, maybe you could add this to the OP? I think many would find it useful.

Done thanks.

I wasn't aware of this review.

First, a highly useful mod that simplifies my game experience tremendously.  Thanks to @Diazofor creating it and @linuxgurugamerfor maintaining it.

Suggestion:  To improve the UI slightly, given that group action part+command text in the Action window often runs off the right hand edge of the window (which is not sizable), you might consider removing the Action Group Description (or Title, if you will) since it already shows in the corresponding edit field in AGExt window.  This would save some space.  However, I do appreciate having all that information in one place, too.  Hmmm...conundrum.

Or, perhaps make the Action window sizable and horizontally scrollable when too narrow.

I also noted recently that in the main window (AGExt) the word "Show" and the StateVis button overlap the vertical scroll bar of the command list when that scrollbar is visible.  (Minor stuff but should you have nothing else to do...ha, ha, ha ! Nothing else to do!!  I really crack myself up sometimes).

I have a bug I think.

The mod works well in the editor. Also when on the launch pad, the button is showing on Blizzy's toolbar.
But I don't see the window. When I hit key one, I do get the crew report as I assigned in the editor - so the action button works, but I can't see the window listing the buttons on screen. If I right click the AGX button in Blizzy's toolbar, I do see the editor window and the mod seems to function well.

 

So all in all, everything seems fine, but the window giving me information about the buttons I've assigned, and gives me the possibility to click the buttons, is missing.
https://1drv.ms/i/s!AvTGPhVqr_5ngqAdGmRcBef33x4UzA

Outputfile

https://1drv.ms/t/s!AvTGPhVqr_5ngqAfV4aiFg1Hy4d7tQ

@Cheesecake

While I'm pretty sure it isn't your problem, there is an update to ModuleManager which you should install, it fixes a bug.  You have 3.0.1 installed, it's up to 3.0.3

That being said, it's very strange, the error I'm seeing in your log file is as if the ModuleAGX isn't installed in a part in the editor, which is strange since it is put there at game start time.

Please upload your ModuleManager.configcache file.

Edited February 11, 2018 by linuxgurugamer

I'm not familiar with the Infernal Robotics stuff, but if I'm reading this correctly, you have an old version of the IRSurfaceSampler, from what I see in the log file you have 1.0.1.5, what I found on Github seems to be 1.0.1.7

This dll is not being loaded due to it's need for KSPUtil, which was in an older version of KSP

Like, is there say a button that will automatically add all existing solar panels/drills/etc. to an action group or do you have to add them all manually?

9 hours ago, b0ss said:

Like, is there say a button that will automatically add all existing solar panels/drills/etc. to an action group or do you have to add them all manually?

If the panels were added with symmetry, then they all show up when you click on one of the set.  If not, then you have to add them manually.
Ah yeah I remember that bit from Kottabos' video. Can we expect to ever have functionality like I described though?
